result.execSummary:
The defendant Daquan D. Diamond was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Cases called at 10:18 AM: 21CF1350, 22CF7, 22CF605.
Defendant Daquan D. Diamond appeared by video, in custody from the Chippewa County Jail.  Attorney David W. Field in court for Daquan D. Diamond.  Deputy District Attorney Angela Beranek in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Agreement has been reached. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
22CF605: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 5 as charged in the Information and is sentenced to Court Costs/surcharges, Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
21CF1350: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1 as charged in the information. 22CF7: Defendant pleads to Count 1 as charged in the Information. 
Sentence is Withheld and the Defendant is placed on 3 Years of Probation with the the following conditions:
180 Days of Jail with Huber (22CF7) all but 60 days are stayed pending further order of the Court. No contact with Co-Defendant Lamont Goss. 
No contact with A.P., K.S. or L.G. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Court Costs/surcharges. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Restitution in the amount of $530 plus the 10% surcharge for a total of $583.00 to be paid fin full within 6 Months of release.
Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.
